intro: Geissanthus obtusus, commonly known as the blunt-leaved geissanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are broad and oval, with a distinctive blunt or rounded tip. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found growing in rocky or mountainous terrain.
